org.ctoolkit.restapi.client.googleapis

Class GoogleApiCredentialFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ctoolkit.restapi.client.googleapis.GoogleApiCredentialFactory

  • public abstract class GoogleApiCredentialFactory
extends Object
    The factory to build credential instance to allow calls to Google APIs on behalf of the application instead of an end-user by OAuth 2.0.

    OAuth 2.0 allows users to share specific data with application (for example, contact lists) while keeping their usernames, passwords, and other information private.

    Author:
    Aurel Medvegy

      • authorize

        public com.google.api.client.http.HttpRequestInitializer authorize(Collection<String> scopes,
                                                          String userAccount)
                                                            throws GeneralSecurityException,
                                                                   IOException
        Creates the thread-safe Google-specific implementation of the OAuth 2.0.
        Parameters:
        scopes - the space-separated OAuth scopes to use with the the service account flow or null for none.
        userAccount - the email address. If you want to impersonate a user account, specify the email address. Useful for domain-wide delegation.
        Returns:
        the thread-safe credential instance
        Throws:
        GeneralSecurityException, - IOException
        GeneralSecurityException
        IOException
